result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert J. Hatfield was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Forgery-Uttering, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
With Huber privileges.  Jail to commence on or before November 23, 2015.  Submit to DNA sample at booking.  Restitution surcharge to be paid prior to report date.
Consecutive to: any other sentences.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Robert J. Hatfield in court with attorney Melville Peter Middleton.  Michael Albrecht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states case and parties state appearances.  Atty Middleton states there is an agreement and states that.  State is in agreement.  Court notes NC plea accepted on 8/13/2015 to Ct 1.  Court inquires re: PSI/wants information re: DE's history.  State makes statement re: that.  Atty Middleton responds.  Court admonishes DE and sentences.  Court advises DE re: voting rights, felony firearm warnings and appeal rights.

Ct 1:
6 months jail w/huber consecutive to any other sentence

Costs of $528.00 to be paid w/in 60 days or set up payment plan

DNA sample to be provided
